alert.note: Alert for Harvey; McPherson; Rice; Saline (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 6:11AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McPherson, northeastern Reno, northwestern Harvey, eastern Rice and southwestern Saline Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 611 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Brookville to Nickerson. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hutchinson, Mcpherson, Lindsborg, South Hutchinson, Halstead, Moundridge, Inman, Buhler, Burrton, Galva, Marquette, Assaria, Windom, Falun, Willowbrook, Mcpherson Airport, Hutchinson Airport and Bridgeport. This includes Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 47 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for central and south central Kansas.
